result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
11:29 AM Defendant Heather Marie Wienke in court.  Attorney David L. Christian in court for Heather Marie Wienke.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Christian has an agreement with the State.  Atty Christian states plea agreement to Count 3.  Count 4 to be dismissed and read-in. Parties are requesting a PSI.  Atty Juech agrees.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Defendant enters a Guilty plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds the defendant guilty of Count 3 and orders the judgment of conviction as of today's date. 
Count 4 to be dismissed and read-in
PSI ordered.
set for sentencing
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on December 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

3:42 PM Defendant Heather Marie Wienke in court.  Attorney David L. Christian appeared by video for Heather Marie Wienke.  Prosecuting attorney Clifford C. Burdon appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Christian does not have an offer at this time.  Atty Burdon is not seeing that an offer was sent on the matter.  The State will mail an offer to the Attorney.
BY THE COURT:  Set status
bond continued
Status hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 11:15 am.
Status hearing on October 10, 2022 at 11:15 am.
to Preliminary Hearing

Prior: 242 W 4Th St # 6, Westfield, WI 53964

Atty Christian makes bail motion arguments and asks for a reduction of bond of $2,500.  Atty Juech has no objection.

BY THE COURT:  Based on the stipulation; court will modify the cash bond from $5,000 to $2,500 cash with the same conditions.

Atty Juech files the information electronically with the Court.  Atty Christian did not get the information yet.  Court will print a copy.  Atty Christian now received a copy of the information and waives its reading. 
Attorney request the Court enter a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Court advises defendant of maximum penalties.  Defendant understands.  

BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. 
set status

4:08 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Heather Marie Wienke in court.  Attorney David L. Christian in court for Heather Marie Wienke. 
Atty Christian states that the defendant will be waiving the Prelim today and has discussed the waiver with his client.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.
Status hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Status hearing on September 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
for Reduction of Bond

Atty Christian waives time limits for preliminary hearing, if needed but requests it get put on calendar as soon as possible.  Court questions defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver of time limits.  Atty Christian states they will be waiving the preliminary hearing.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds time limits have been made.  Set for waiver of preliminary hearing.

Court advises her the different ways of getting an attorney.  Defendant wants to get a Public Defender.  

BY THE COURT:  Court will reset the IA

3:23 PM Defendant Heather Marie Wienke appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Annie Getsinger appears as a special appearance on behalf of the defendant for bond. 
Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court confirms address. Court signed a probable cause statement this morning. Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes. 
Defendant believes that she will qualify for PD appointment.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands. 

Atty Juech requests a $5,000 cash bond with conditions:
Atty Getsinger makes bail arguments.  Atty Getsinger asks that the defendant's purse be returned.  Court questions the State.  Atty Juech has no idea where the purse is.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $5,000 Cash bond with conditions: 
*No going on the premises of the Pioneer Mobil Gas Station in Westfield, WI
